summary: The Young African Leaders Initiative Act of 2025 (YALI Act) aims to establish a U.S. government initiative to build the capacity of young African leaders and entrepreneurs in sub-Saharan Africa. It focuses on leadership development, entrepreneurship, public administration, peace and security, and connecting young African leaders. The Act establishes a YALI program overseen by the Secretary of State, supports the Mandela Washington Fellowship, and mandates regional leadership centers. It requires an implementation plan, annual reports to Congress, and has a sunset clause after five years.
